result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devante Faye Seamster

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. motion in limine
Received and Filed. Defense Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Devante Faye Seamster.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Police Officer J. Ayala. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 16. Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent is in trial; unable to appear.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9-6-2022

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel in Plea Trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 8-16-2022
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Devante Faye Seamster in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Devante Faye Seamster in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
